eus.julenugalde.jspworld.model

Interface Model

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WorldModel

    public interface Model
    Abstract model for the application. Contains methods to retreive and update data of countries and cities from the source.

    Information on the 'world' database used:

    CREATE TABLE city (
      ID int NOT NULL,
      Name char(35) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      CountryCode char(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      District char(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      Population int NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',
      PRIMARY KEY (ID)
    )

    CREATE TABLE country (
      Code char(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      Name char(52) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      Continent varchar(20) CHECK(Continent in ('Asia','Europe','North America','Africa',   'Oceania','Antarctica','South America')) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'Asia',
      Region char(26) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      SurfaceArea decimal(10,2) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0.00',
      IndepYear smallint DEFAULT NULL,
      Population int NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',
      LifeExpectancy decimal(3,1) DEFAULT NULL,
      GNP decimal(10,2) DEFAULT NULL,
      GNPOld decimal(10,2) DEFAULT NULL,
      LocalName char(45) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      GovernmentForm char(45) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      HeadOfState char(60) DEFAULT NULL,
      Capital int DEFAULT NULL,
      Code2 char(2) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      PRIMARY KEY (Code)
    )

    CREATE TABLE countrylanguage (
      CountryCode char(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      Language char(30) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
      IsOfficial char(1) CHECK(IsOfficial IN ('T','F')) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'F',
      Percentage decimal(4,1) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0.0',
      PRIMARY KEY (CountryCode,Language)
    )

    • Method Detail

      • openDBConnection

        boolean openDBConnection(ConnectionData connectionData,
                         java.lang.String schemaName)
        Establish a connection to the database.
        Parameters:
        connectionData - Information of the server address and port, user name and password.
        schemaName - Name of the DB schema where the world tables are included.
        Returns:
        true if the connection was opened correctly, false otherwise.

      • getCountryList

        java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Country> getCountryList()
        Retreives the information of all the world countries
        Returns:
        LinkedHashMap with the information of all the countries. The key used is the 3-character country code

      • getCountryList

        java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Country> getCountryList(Continent continent)
        Retreives the information of the countries from a continent
        Parameters:
        continent - Element in the Continent enumeration
        Returns:
        LinkedHashMap with the information of the countries in the specified continent. The key used is the 3-character country code

      • getCountryByCode

        Country getCountryByCode(java.lang.String code)
        Retrieves the information of a country identified by the country code.
        Parameters:
        code - 3-character country code.
        Returns:
        Country object with the country's information; null if the code is wrong or it does not correspond to any country.

      • getCityListByCountry

        java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,City> getCityListByCountry(java.lang.String countryCode)
        Retreives the information of all the cities which are part of a country.
        Parameters:
        countryCode - String with the 3-character country code.
        Returns:
        LinkedHashMap with the information of all the cities in the country. The key used is the city identifier (city.getId()).

      • getCityListByCountry

        java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,City> getCityListByCountry(Country country)
        Retreives the information of all the cities which are part of a country.
        Parameters:
        country - Instance of Country with the country's information.
        Returns:
        LinkedHashMap with the information of all the cities in the country. The key used is the city identifier (city.getId()).

      • addCity

        boolean addCity(City city)
        Add new city to the database. The id value in the City object will not be taken into account and the database will establish one. It can happen that there are duplicate values (e.g. cities with the same name)
        Parameters:
        city - City to be inserted
        Returns:
        true if the insertion was successful, false otherwise

      • closeDBConnection

        void closeDBConnection()
        Attempts to close the connection with the database.
